title: Homepage UI updates: hero CTA removal, Our Approach card redesign, How It Works number layout

requirements.text: Remove the "Contact Us Today" button from the homepage Hero section so only the "Schedule a Consultation" CTA remains.

quotes: On the hero section, I want you to remove the contact us today button entirely.

acceptanceCriteria: In HeroSection, the button with label "Contact Us Today" is no longer rendered.
Hero layout remains visually balanced on mobile and desktop with a single CTA button.
No unused handler/function remains for the removed button (e.g., contact button click handler is removed if no longer needed).

requirements.text: Update the homepage "Our Approach" cards to (1) replace the numeric labels with icons in a style consistent with the rest of the website, (2) use a white card background, (3) apply a permanent gold border using the site’s existing gold theme color, and (4) add an on-click subtle upward-lift interaction that does not change the border color on click.

quotes: On the our approach section, I want you to replace the numbers on the cards with icons.
I want the background color of the cards in the approach section to be white. They can have a gold borderline color instead, but not on click. They must have a gold borderline color.
And then, I want the cards to also have an on click effect. Maybe like on click they must sort of like jump out a bit, but not necessarily pop out.
Consistent style with the rest of the website
Use the gold color theme of the website

acceptanceCriteria: Each Our Approach card no longer displays the numeric text (1–4) and instead displays an icon per card.
Our Approach cards render with a white background in light mode (and remain legible in dark mode).
Our Approach cards have a gold border derived from the existing accent/gold theme token (not a newly introduced hard-coded random gold).
The gold border remains gold in default, hover, focus, and active/clicked states (no border color change on click).
Clicking/tapping a card triggers a subtle upward-lift effect (e.g., small translateY negative) and returns to normal when released; effect works on desktop and mobile.

requirements.text: Update the homepage "How It Works" section so each step’s number appears outside of (separate from) the text box/card, with the number shown first and then the bordered text box. Apply a gold border to the step text boxes using the site’s existing gold theme color.

quotes: The numbers must be outside of the boxes, so it must be the numbers and then it must be the boxes with the text. The numbers and then the boxes.
The boxes can also have a gold borderline color.

acceptanceCriteria: In HowItWorksSection, the step number is visually outside/separate from the step card/box (not inside the card content container).
The layout preserves the existing step titles and order (1 through 5).
Each step’s text box/card has a gold border using the site’s existing accent/gold theme token.
The section remains responsive and readable on mobile and desktop without overlapping number + card content.

constraints: Frontend must not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or other paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Use English for any user-facing text.
Backend is a single Motoko actor; do not introduce additional backend services.
nonGoals: No new backend features or persistence changes.
No changes to testimonials carousel, FAQ underline, or focus outline bug unless required by these UI updates.
No redesign of copy/content beyond the specified button removal and numeric-to-icon swap.
